container.heading: Health Certificate and Rabies Certificate for Companion Animals

para.text: For the purpose of this chapter "companion animal" means any rabbit, bird, rodent, fish, reptile, amphibian, nonhuman primate, and other species of animal kept for pleasure rather than utility and accustomed to living in or about human habitation.
"Companion animal" also means any dog or cat, regardless of its utilitarian purpose.
Horses, cattle, sheep, goats, swine, or poultry; or
Any other animals kept for bona fide research or agricultural uses.
When issuing a health certificate or a rabies certificate for a companion animal, a veterinarian may not issue a blank or incomplete certificate. The veterinarian’s signature shall be:
An electronic signature of the veterinarian, affixed at the direction of the treating veterinarian at the time of vaccination.
A health certificate shall contain (if applicable to the species), but not be limited to the following information:
Breed if purebred, or predominant breed type if of mixed breeding;
Any vaccinations administered, including date and type.

section.heading: Certification of Health.
section.text: If the animal in question is to be shipped out of state, the signature of the veterinarian, who shall be accredited in Maryland, shall be preceded by the following certification:

I certify that I personally examined the animal(s) described hereon and have found same on this day to be free from visible signs of infectious, contagious, or communicable disease; that the results of any tests are as indicated above; that I am familiar with the stated entrance requirements of the state or county destination; and that this certificate is issued in compliance therewith.

section.heading: Scope of Authority of these Regulations.
section.text: Nothing contained within these regulations shall preempt, restrict, supersede, or duplicate the authority of the Secretary of Health in Health-General Article, Annotated Code of Maryland.
